episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including the behavior of cleaner fish and their interactions with client fish, the peculiarities of an Al-Qaeda job application form, the challenges faced by LEGO Universe in moderating user-generated content, and the ambitious project of creating a 'chickenosaurus' by genetically modifying chickens to exhibit dinosaur traits.

facts.fact: Fish who work as cleaners can cheat their bosses and their bosses can punish them.
Al-Qaeda's job application form includes a question asking who should be contacted in the event that the applicant becomes a martyr.
The single biggest expense in the computer game LEGO Universe was to hire human moderators to make sure that people weren't making LEGO penises.
The man who inspired the main character in Jurassic Park is now building a chickenosaurus.
